property.name: author
property.configure: Yang Zhao, Ilkay Altintas, Wibke Sudholt

configure.p: The StatusChecker actor checks the status of a running job. The actor executes a Unix command (e.g., ls or C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/IEXPLORE.EXE) and compares the execution results to a specified regular expression (e.g., *.html). The StatusChecker actor depends on system-specific executables and is operating-system specific.

Commands are specified with the command parameter or via the command port and may take an optional argument. Output the execution results to a file by specifying an outputFile. Once the execution is complete, the actor outputs the results as a string via the output port.

property.name: port:command
property.configure: An input port that accepts the command to be executed. Commands must be specified as a string.

property.name: port:arguments
property.configure: An input port that accepts command arguments (optional).

property.name: port:infileHandle
property.configure: An input port that accepts the path to an input file (optional). Used if the command accepts an input file instead of a list of arguments.

property.name: port:trigger
property.configure: A multiport that has no declared type (in other words, the port can accept any data type: double, int, array, etc.) If the port is connected, the actor will not fire until the trigger port receives an input token. Connecting the port is optional, but useful when scheduling the actor to perform at a certain time.

property.name: port:outfileHandle
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts the output file path, if an outputFile has been specified.

property.name: port:output
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts data generated by the executed command, output as a string after the command has finished executing.

property.name: port:exitCode
property.configure: An output port that indicates whether or not the command executed successfully. Exit code will be 1 if the command executes successfully.

property.name: port:iterativeOutput
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts the output of each iteration.

property.name: prop:command
property.configure: The command to be executed on the remote host. Commands must be specified as a string.

property.name: prop:outputFile
property.configure: The name of the output file (optional). If an output file is specified, the output of the command will be written to that file.

property.name: prop:hasTrigger
property.configure: Select to activate a trigger input port.

property.name: prop:sleepTime
property.configure: The delay, in milliseconds, between checks. The parameter is of type long. The default is 0, meaning that the actor will not sleep between checks.

property.name: prop:checkCondition
property.configure: A regular expression that the actor will compare against the output.

property.name: prop:maxChecks
property.configure: The maximum number of checks. The default value is -1, meaning that the actor will keep checking until the condition is satisfied.
